title: additionalram.github.io
description: My old and now outdated portfolio website. I started making it when I was just learning about HTML and CSS and updated it as I made progress. But now, I've come a long way into learning other frameworks and general about design so I was no longer satisfied with its design, which is why I made a brand new site in Next.js.
keyFeatures: Responsive design: Significant effort was put into making sure the website adapts to the user's screen size and functions regardless of the device it's being viewed on.
API integration: The portfolio section of the page dynamically loads content that is not hardcoded so it's easier to update.
Dark / light mode: The website features both a dark and a light mode with a switcher and can detect what the user prefers.
Animations: Scroll in effects, hover animations and more make the website feel alive and dynamic, and less like you're viewing a static document.
improvements: The page's light mode could be improved to look better.
Better image loading could be introduced so that a low resolution version is loaded first before the full image fades in.
The quality of the projects in the portfolio could be better. For example, the entire DOM projects section does not need to be there.

title: Simphase
description: A clone of the old website my father's company used to use. The original was made with themes and WordPress by someone else. This project was an exercise in replicating a professional grade website in order to demonstrate my web development knowledge.
keyFeatures: Responsive design: The website adapts to the user's screen size.
Animations: The website features smooth scroll-in as well as hover animations to ensure it feels lively.
improvements: Some glitches in within the layout of the about us page could be improved, such as the team members description not properly aligning.
Some sections of the site look bad or incomplete on mobile devices even though they partially respond to the screen size.
Some sections have poor visibility on certain devices due to background image.
The language switcher that was in the original website was never implemented, the flag of the UK is lonely.
The website is only in light mode, a dark mode could be implemented.

title: Pohlarz Ingenieure
description: My first work for somebody else. I designed and developed a responsive portfolio website for Pohlarz Ingenieure. Development is temporarily paused pending feedback from the client.
keyFeatures: Responsive design: The website responds to changes in screen size and looks good on any device, as every website should.
Animations: Nice animations are all over the website, making navigating around a pleasure for your eyes.
Parallax scroll: Many elements have parallax scrolling properties which gives the page sense of depth.
Dynamic fetching: All projects are fetched dynamically, making everything easy to edit and efficient to load.
Image loading: The images load lazily and show low quality versions of themselves before loading to ensure a good experience even on slow internet connections.
improvements: The images will be viewable in a gallery form with ability to zoom in.
Projects are currently placeholders and are to be replaced with real ones.
Certain issues with mobile navbar need to be fixed.

title: Project 'Flowdepth'
description: This project attempts to solve the massive problem of procrastination that many people my age including myself have been dealing with. I am hopeful this project helps people spend more time productively and actually have fun working.
keyFeatures: Track how much time you spend productively, similar to 'Focus sessions' on Windows 11. Create separate categories, each with their own timers, settable goals and reminders.
Social progress: Share your progress with friends to boost dopamine and introduce accountability. If you've been slacking off, the friends you've added will know.
Collaborate: Create collaborated projects and track the time of many different users to boost productivity in group tasks.
Cross platform: You improve your productivity on the web, on desktop or mobile.
improvements: The project is very early in development and far from release. Improvements will be pushed as updates as development progresses.
This project may not start development for a long time due to other commitments in my life.
